messages.subject: Tosogu.com
messages.msgSnippet: http://tosogu.blogspot.com/ All, I have started a blog, not so much a forum but more a repository for information on tosogu. We have a few contributors but
messages.messageBody:
http://tosogu.blogspot.com/

All, I have started a blog, not so much a forum but more a repository
for information on tosogu. We have a few contributors but most are busy
at present and articles a slow coming in, but they will come. I have an
interesting article on Owari tsuba being translated at the moment, and
hope to have several stories on Japan after my October trip.

Please have a look if you have time, this is not run as a forum with
moderators, rules and open discussion, but as a collective wanting to
place as much information on Tosogu in one spot as possible.

If anyone would like to offer an article, just let me know.

Richard Turner

messages.subject: Sue-Koto JSS/US publication
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all - Surprised nobody has not mentioned this new 2-volume publication on Sue-Koto: Japanese Swords of the 15th and 16th Centuries, the latest publication
messages.messageBody:
Hi all -

Surprised nobody has not mentioned this new 2-volume publication on Sue-Koto: Japanese Swords of the 15th and 16th Centuries, the latest publication being offered by the JSS/US at a bargain price (thanks to an anonymous financial contributor)...$50 plus shipping. Harry Watson is handling orders afu@... for the JSS/US. Double-spiral bound, 5-1/2" x 8-1/2" size. Two fat volumes chuck full of great information, cheap!!!

Ron
STL

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
